title.value: Predictive Inference with Feature Conformal Prediction
title.justification: The title 'Predictive Inference with Feature Conformal Prediction' is prominently displayed at the beginning of the provided paper.
title.quote: PREDICTIVE INFERENCE WITH FEATURE CONFORMAL PREDICTION

extractions.description: The paper proposes Feature Conformal Prediction (Feature CP), which extends conformal prediction techniques to semantic feature spaces using deep representation learning. This method aims to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of predictive inference by leveraging the inductive biases of deep learning features. Theoretical and empirical validations are provided, demonstrating superior performance on tasks like ImageNet classification and Cityscapes segmentation.

type.justification: The paper primarily focuses on proposing new theoretical methods, proofs, and validation of the new Feature Conformal Prediction method.
type.quote: From a theoretical perspective, we demonstrate that feature conformal prediction provably outperforms regular conformal prediction under mild assumptions.

name.justification: The study is central to handling uncertainty in predictive inference, specifically using conformal prediction techniques.
name.quote: Conformal prediction is a distribution-free technique for establishing valid prediction intervals.

name.justification: The paper presents experiments on tasks like ImageNet classification and Cityscapes segmentation, which are core to the computer vision domain.
name.quote: experiments on existing predictive inference benchmarks, we also demonstrate the state-of-the-art performance of the proposed methods on large-scale tasks such as ImageNet classification and Cityscapes image segmentation.

name.justification: The core of the paper is about extending and proving the theoretical foundations of conformal prediction using deep learning features.
name.quote: From a theoretical perspective, we demonstrate that feature conformal prediction provably outperforms regular conformal prediction under mild assumptions.

name.justification: Feature Conformal Prediction (Feature CP) is the main model proposed in the paper, extending conformal prediction techniques into the feature space.
name.quote: we thus propose the Feature Conformal Prediction (Feature CP) framework

is_contributed.justification: Feature Conformal Prediction (Feature CP) is a novel contribution introduced and developed within the scope of the paper.
is_contributed.quote: we thus propose the Feature Conformal Prediction (Feature CP) framework

is_executed.justification: The model was empirically validated using real data in the study, indicating it was executed.
is_executed.quote: We conduct extensive experiments under both synthetic and realistic settings (e.g., pixel-level image segmentation) to corroborate the effectiveness of the proposed algorithm.

is_compared.justification: Feature Conformal Prediction was compared with traditional conformal prediction methods, showing its superior performance.
is_compared.quote: From a theoretical perspective, we demonstrate that feature conformal prediction provably outperforms regular conformal prediction under mild assumptions.

name.justification: Conformalized Quantile Regression (CQR) is another model discussed in the context of improving conformal prediction methods.

is_contributed.justification: CQR is referenced and used to demonstrate the application of feature-level techniques, not introduced by this paper.
is_contributed.quote: we propose Feature CQR with insights from CQR (Romano et al., 2019), a prominent adaptive conformal prediction method with remarkable performance, to demonstrate the universality of our technique.

is_executed.justification: CQR was used as a reference model for comparison and validation of Feature CP and Feature CQR.
is_executed.quote: Feature CQR shows shorter bands while maintaining good coverage performance compared to CQR

is_compared.justification: CQR was used as a comparison point to demonstrate the performance of the proposed Feature CP and Feature CQR models.
is_compared.quote: we propose Feature CQR with insights from CQR (Romano et al., 2019), a prominent adaptive conformal prediction method with remarkable performance, to demonstrate the universality of our technique.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper references another study to explain CQR.
referenced_paper_title.quote: we propose Feature CQR with insights from CQR (Romano et al., 2019)

name.justification: Vanilla Conformal Prediction (Vanilla CP) is the traditional conformal prediction method which Feature CP is compared against.
name.quote: Despite its remarkable effectiveness, vanilla conformal prediction (vanilla CP) is only deployed in the output space

is_contributed.justification: Vanilla CP is an existing method used as a baseline in the paper.
is_contributed.quote: Despite its remarkable effectiveness, vanilla conformal prediction (vanilla CP) is only deployed in the output space

is_executed.justification: Vanilla CP was executed as part of the comparisons made with Feature CP.
is_executed.quote: Vanilla CP, we conduct extensive experiments under both synthetic and realistic settings

is_compared.justification: Vanilla CP was used as a baseline to compare against the proposed Feature CP model.
is_compared.quote: We next present vanilla CP in Algorithm 1. Moreover, we demonstrate its theoretical guarantee in Proposition 2, based on the following notation of exchangeability in Assumption 1.

referenced_paper_title.value: Algorithmic Learning in a Random World
referenced_paper_title.justification: Algorithmic Learning in a Random World by Vovk et al. is the reference source for Vanilla CP.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Under Assumption 1, the confidence band C1−α (X 0 ) returned by Algorithm 1 satisfies P(Y 0 ∈ C1−α (X 0 )) ≥ 1 − α.

name.justification: ImageNet is used in experiments to demonstrate the effectiveness of Feature CP in classification tasks.
name.quote: state-of-the-art performance of the proposed methods on large-scale tasks such as ImageNet classification

referenced_paper_title.value: ImageNet: A large-scale hierarchical image database
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is a well-known benchmark for image classification tasks and is referenced accordingly.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Jia Deng, Wei Dong, Richard Socher, Li-Jia Li, Kai Li, Li Fei-Fei. ImageNet: A large-scale hierarchical image database. 2009.

name.justification: Cityscapes is used in the paper for experiments on image segmentation, demonstrating Feature CP's performance.
name.quote: state-of-the-art performance of the proposed methods on large-scale tasks such as ImageNet classification and Cityscapes image segmentation

referenced_paper_title.value: The Cityscapes Dataset for Semantic Urban Scene Understanding
referenced_paper_title.justification: Cityscapes is a referenced dataset known for its use in image segmentation tasks.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Marius Cordts, Mohamed Omran, Sebastian Ramos, Timo Rehfeld, Markus Enzweiler, Rodrigo Benenson, Uwe Franke, Stefan Roth, Bernt Schiele. The Cityscapes Dataset for Semantic Urban Scene Understanding. 2016.

name.justification: PyTorch is explicitly mentioned as used for implementing the FCN model in the experiments.
name.quote: We use the ResNet50 backbone as f and take two convolution layers as g. We select the Layer4 output of ResNet50 as our surrogate feature v.

referenced_paper_title.value: PyTorch: An Imperative Style, High-Performance Deep Learning Library
referenced_paper_title.justification: PyTorch is a widely used deep learning library, referenced for its application in this paper's experiments.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Paszke et al., 'PyTorch: An Imperative Style, High-Performance Deep Learning Library. 2019.
